column2: the real atmosphere is less sensitive to CO2 than what has been forecast by climate models
column10: Prof. John Christy incorrectly claims to show climate models are too sensitive to carbon dioxide

column2: Increased atmospheric carbon dioxide has helped raise global food production and reduce poverty.
column10: Wall Street Journal op-ed ignores evidence of negative impacts of increasing CO2
column11: [' Rodney Nichols, The Wall Street Journal, 31 Oct. 2016 \xa0 ']

column2: Melting of Arctic sea ice and polar icecaps is not occurring at ‘unnatural’ rates and does not constitute evidence of a human impact on the climate.
column10: Heartland Institute report incorrectly claims no evidence of human impacts in melting ice
column11: [' Fred Singer, Robert Carter, Heartland Institute, 2016 \xa0 ']

column2: Forward projections of solar cyclicity imply the next few decades may be marked by global cooling rather than warming, despite continuing CO2 emissions.
column10: A lull in solar activity would have little effect on global temperatures; claims of “global cooling” are not based on science
column11: [' Fred Singer, Robert Carter, Heartland Institute, 2016 \xa0 ']

column2: [climate models] systematically over-estimate the sensitivity of climate to carbon dioxide ... and modelers exclude forcings and feedbacks that run counter to their mission
column10: Heartland Institute report’s claim that climate models are too sensitive to CO2 does not reflect evidence
column11: [' Fred Singer, Robert Carter, Heartland Institute, 2016 \xa0 ']

column2: The temperature is not rising nearly as fast as the alarmist computer models predicted. You know, it’s much, much less, factors of 2 or 3 less.
column10: In CNN interview, William Happer incorrectly claims temperatures don’t match climate model projections

column2: Trump's action could push the Earth over the brink, to become like Venus, with a temperature of two hundred and fifty degrees, and raining sulphuric acid.
column10: Earth is not at risk of becoming a hothouse like Venus, as Stephen Hawking claimed

column2: Neither the rate nor the magnitude of the reported late twentieth century surface warming (1979–2000) lay outside normal natural variability.
column10: Natural variability can not explain modern global warming, as Heartland Institute report claims
column11: [' Fred Singer, Robert Carter, Heartland Institute, 2016 \xa0 ']

column2: Most likely the primary control knob [on climate change] is the ocean waters and this environment that we live in.
column10: Energy Secretary Rick Perry incorrectly claims CO2 is not primary cause of climate change

column2: We know that humans have most flourished during times of, what, warming trends. I think there are assumptions made that because the climate is warming, that that is necessarily a bad thing.
column10: EPA’s Scott Pruitt incorrectly suggests climate change might not be “a bad thing”

column2: NOAA has adjusted past temperatures to look colder than they were and recent temperatures to look warmer than they were.
column10: Breitbart repeats blogger’s unsupported claim that NOAA manipulates data to exaggerate warming

column2: Sea-level rise does not seem to depend on ocean temperature, and certainly not on CO2
column10: Fred Singer incorrectly claims sea level rise is not caused by climate change

column2: El Niño drove record highs in global temperatures suggesting rise may not be down to man-made emissions.
column10: Daily Mail claim about 2016 global temperature record is misleading

column2: there is no relationship between temperature and carbon dioxide emissions by ­humans[...] carbon dioxide has had a minuscule effect on global climate
column10: Ian Plimer wrongly claims that carbon dioxide emissions do not cause climate change

column2: Doubling the concentration of atmospheric CO2 from its pre-industrial level, in the absence of other forcings and feedbacks, would likely cause a warming of ~0.3°C to 1.1°C
column10: Climate sensitivity estimate given in Heartland Institute’s report is misleading
column11: [' Fred Singer, Robert Carter, Heartland Institute, 2017 \xa0 ']

column2: Climate projections using models based on it [the water vapor feedback] have consistently failed
column10: Boston Globe column claims that climate models have consistently failed based on no evidence

column2: I would not agree that [carbon dioxide is] a primary contributor to the global warming that we see.
column10: Science shows that humans are primarily responsible for climate change, counter to EPA Administrator Scott Pruitt’s claim

column2: no one really knows if last year (2016) was a (global temperature) record
column10: The Wall Street Journal fails to acknowledge that 2016 was the warmest year on record

column2: Solar forcings are not too small to explain twentieth century warming. In fact, their effect could be equal to or greater than the effect of CO2 in the atmosphere.
column10: The Sun cannot explain recent global warming, contrary to what Heartland Institute report claims
column11: [' Fred Singer, Robert Carter, Heartland Institute, 2016 \xa0 ']

column2: The ­atmospheric residency time of carbon dioxide is five years and it is quickly sequestered into plants, marine life, oceans and sediments.
column10: Ian Plimer incorrectly claims human-caused emissions are short-lived
